definition: thick/deep or profound/kind/generous/rich or strong in flavor/to favor/to stress

sentences.english: And we had the cheek to call the Taliban vandals.
sentences.chinese: 而我們還曾厚顏無恥地稱塔利班爲野蠻人。

sentences.english: It is the most impudent piece of pretension I ever heard of in my life.
sentences.chinese: 這是我一生中從沒聽說過的最厚顏無恥的一項要求了。

sentences.english: To tell a barefaced lie to your friends will create bad relationships.
sentences.chinese: 告訴朋友厚顏無恥的謊言，將會造成不良的關係。

sentences.english: And the site's cheeky bravado rubs salt in the wounds.
sentences.chinese: 並且網站厚顏無恥並自信滿滿地往它們的傷口上撒鹽。
她的厚顏使我大爲喫驚。

sentences.english: It illustrated the thuggeryand brazenness of the state machine.
sentences.chinese: 這很好地詮釋了這個國家機器的暗箱操作和厚顏無恥。

sentences.english: One could only gasp at the sheer effrontery of the man.
sentences.chinese: 那人十足的厚顏無恥讓人們喫驚得無話可說。

sentences.english: Ignorance is the mother of impudence.
sentences.chinese: 厚顏無恥由於愚昧無知。

sentences.english: He had the audacity to go to the party without being invited.
sentences.chinese: 儘管未被邀請，他也敢厚顏地去參加宴會。

sentences.english: What knocks me is his impudence.
sentences.chinese: 他的厚顏無恥使我感到喫驚。

sentences.english: She exactly not as thick as he Yan, said that the half sentence then cannot say.
sentences.chinese: 她到底不如他厚顏，說了半句便說不下去。

sentences.english: The effrontery of that may well supersede anything Goldman and Paulson are alleged to have done.
sentences.chinese: 這種厚顏行爲大概既高盛和鮑爾斯以後無人能敵。

sentences.english: She exactly not as thick for he Yan, said namely the half sentence then cannot mention.
sentences.chinese: 她到底不如他厚顏，說了半句便說不下去。

sentences.english: We want Japan to know him to be bold-faced, is impossible.
sentences.chinese: 我們要日本知道他是厚顏無恥的，是不可能的。
我對你的厚顏無恥感到驚奇。

sentences.english: She said, you are an illegitimate daughter, also have no shame to find people to support you.
sentences.chinese: 她說，你一個私生女，還厚顏無恥地來找人家養你。

definition: scholars tend to disparage one another (idiom)
variant of 敢做敢當|敢做敢当[gan3 zuo4 gan3 dang1]
homosexual/see 斷袖之癖|断袖之癖[duan4 xiu4 zhi1 pi3]
to lend sb a knife to kill sb/to get sb else to do one's dirty work/to attack using the strength of another (idiom)
to have no sense of shame/brazen
to nod one's head and bow (idiom); bowing and scraping/unctuous fawning
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
